column4: I'm amazed that Ubuntu still doesn't have a USB stick image; that alone makes it one of the hardest distros to install
i use usb-creator (from Ubuntu) and it works perfectly.
right, but that still requires you to have a bootable functioning install with X and everything working
Voita says he/she has an existing Ubuntu installation
oh, fair enough then
oh. you meant in general? for people without ubuntu?
and I've just noticed it's been recently packaged for Arch too
I don't get why you have to jump through the iso hoop at all
i agree.
does anyone use these funny shaving mirror things any more?
shaving mirror?
these funny round plastic things that people used to store data on, can't remember what they're called
you bet. i work part time at staples.
in all seriousness, I don't think I've had a CD drive in a PC for about ten years

i work PT at Staples. we push spindle after spindle all year long. but yes, usb sticks are very popular. but people hardly buy external drives. i am sure a lot of them aren't getting backup done properly.
I don't back up, I just keep my work in a git repo and periodically buy a new hard disk
as long as you know you're safe.
well, I back up large uncompressible media files, by dumping them out to other disks
i have a couple of WD MyBooks for that ;)

I've usually got a couple of copies floating about; the only time I've ever run afoul of this was when I lost one of my hosting providers and with it a large SVN repo - but someone else had a full checkout of it
so, Linus's method works
later
